1.text: Now all the tax collectors and sinners were coming close to him to hear him.

2.text: But the Pharisees and scribes began to grumble, saying, “This man welcomes sinners and eats with them!”

3.text: So Jesus told them this parable.

4.text: “Which one of you, if you had one hundred sheep and lost one of them, would not leave the ninety-nine in the wilderness and go after the one that was lost, until he finds it?

5.text: And when he has found it, he carries it on his shoulders, rejoicing!

6.text: Coming home, he calls together his friends and neighbors, telling them, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found my sheep which was lost!’

7.text: I tell you that in the same way, there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous who need no repentance.

8.text: Or what woman, if she had ten drachma coins and lost one, would not light a lamp, sweep the house, and look hard until she finds it?

9.text: And when she has found it, she calls together her friends and neighbors, saying, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found the drachma coin which I had lost!’

10.text: Likewise, I tell you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner who repents.”

11.text: Jesus said, “A certain man had two sons.

12.text: The younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me the share of the estate that will come to me.’ So the father divided his livelihood between them.

13.text: A few days later, the younger son gathered all that he had and traveled to a far country. There, he squandered his property, living immorally.

14.text: When he had spent everything, a severe famine took place in that country, and he began to be in need.

15.text: He went and hired himself to one of the citizens of that country who sent him into his fields to feed pigs.

16.text: He wanted to feed himself with the husks that the pigs ate, but no one gave him anything.

17.text: But when he came to himself, he said, ‘How many of my father’s hired servants have bread enough to spare, and I am dying with hunger!

18.text: I will get up, go to my father, and tell him, “Father, I have sinned against heaven and before you;

19.text: I am no longer worthy to be called your son! Make me as one of your hired servants.”’

20.text: So he set off and went to his father. But while he was still at a distance, his father saw him and was moved with compassion. He ran, and embraced his son, and kissed him.

21.text: Then the son said, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and before you! I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’

22.text: But the father said to his slaves, ‘Bring out the first robe and put it on him! Put a ring on his hand and shoes on his feet!

23.text: Bring the fattened calf, kill it, and let us eat and celebrate;

24.text: for this, my son, was dead, and he is alive again! He was lost and [now he] is found!’ And they began to celebrate.

25.text: Now his elder son was in the field. As he came near to the house, he heard music and dancing.

26.text: Calling one of the servants, he asked what was going on.

27.text: The servant replied, ‘Your brother has returned! Your father has killed the fattened calf, because he has received him back safe and healthy.’

28.text: However, the elder son became angry and he would not go in. Therefore, his father came out and begged him.

29.text: But he answered his father, ‘Look, for so many years I have served you, and I have never disobeyed a commandment of yours. Yet, you never gave me a goat so that I might celebrate with my friends.

30.text: But when this, your son, arrived, he who has devoured your living with prostitutes, you killed the fattened calf for him.’

31.text: The father said to him, ‘Son, you are always with me, and all that is mine is yours!

32.text: But it was fitting to celebrate and to rejoice, for this, your brother, was dead, and is alive again. He was lost and is found!’”
